newsitem.title: USA: TransTexas details Bob West success.
newsitem.headline: TransTexas details Bob West success.

text.p: TransTexas Gas Corp said Tuesday its Palmyra No. 10 natural gas well had encountered 134 net feet of pay in the L1, L2 and L3 sands, after being drilled to a total depth of 11,060 feet.

This well is the eighth to be drilled in a highly productive fault block of Bob West North, where peak production rates are in the range of 27 to 60 million cubic feet of natural gas per day, the company said.

It said four further wells -- the Palmyra No. 9, Palmyra No. 10, Esparanza No. 1 and the Falcon Gas Unit No. 1 -- are expected to add similar production per well as they are completed over the coming weeks.

TransTexas said it has begun a six rig, 20 well program in Bob West North with three wells currently under way -- the Esparanza No. 2, the Palmyra No. 8 and Salinas A No. 3, that the company believes will add similar incremental production and reserves.

"Peak production rates from the expanding north west fault block have averaged over 40 million cubic feet daily gross per well," it pointed out, adding, "We are in the process of adding seven wells that we believe will add equivalent production rates per well.
